title: Support Union
body:
Thats it I am done. Which other support mains are with me? I am sick of arrogant uncaring or worst unskilled ADCs abusing me for not hand feeding them kills, or abusing me for feeding when i land gem engages but they refuse to follow up because they might miss one cs or simply refuse to attack unless its a one hit kill level palm feed. 
I know what is like to play with a good reciprocal adc and its fabulous. You harass and engage and they follow up time and time again, you win lane. But there are ADCs out there that think your job is to make them not have to try for a kill or, simply die so they can farm uninterrupted and then when they have given you no support all game abuse you because they lose.
I am sick of it. I have played support for 2 years, specializing in Leona, Naught and Sona and am just sick of either having to listen to egotistical adcs brag about their carries when i have spoon fed them all game or bitch about my skill when they played badly and fed. 

I am officially now on Support strike, never again will i supp. 2 years of dealing with these wankers in bot lane I'm over it.
Who is with me?

replies.body:
You could complain.

Or you could learn **HOW** to support. Looking at your recent history puts you in the 95% of OCE that don't know how to properly support.

Here is a question for you: What are the two key roles that a support player should play for their team?

Its already hard to climb out of bronze as a support, but if you know these two things and work on them, you have a much better chance, and also to not annoy your ADC.

I play cc tank or AP heal/harass. I know HOW to support ffs i have been playing support for 3 god dam years. My issue is with bad ADCS who cant calm their own mistakes and blame everything on me. In bronze there are a lot of them. A lot of decent adcs have befriended me and played further games with me supporting them.  I know what i am doing as a support but some adcs are toxic and unsupportable.
If you are in bronze you do not know how to support stop thinking that you are perfect and start trying to get better :)

I know i have a lot to learn. Still so do my adcs. My point is with all our skill discrepancy ADCs should have some goddamn respect for their support. What i am sick of is the verbal abuse and ego of adc players. When i make plays i want credit dammit.

I think you should have a go at playing adc. You will learn what you want from your support and the jump form supp to adc is easy. Your map awareness should be ok and your trades should be good too if you're an aggressive support. From playing adc I improved my positioning, peel, engage timing and if when it is possible to make a kill or when its best to retreat.

I used to think support was a thankless position but now i know I was just a poor support. I have improved but there is always room for more improvement.  

I hope you reach the level of skill that shows the impact of a good support in the game. Because we don't see enough support plays

Instead of being mad over supporting in Bronze for 2 years, why not just stop earlier?
I try not to supp in yoloq as you are at the mercy of your adc and if they suck you lose lane. Happy to support a competent adc i duo with  but yolo q forget it.

> [{quoted}](name=Sailor Jupiter,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=EHoEtFWo,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-02-09T17:15:28.914+0000)
>
> Here's some tips:
> - You should be buying Sightstone in 100% of your support games
> - Damage isn't important for tank supports so try swapping out your Sunfire purchases with Randuins for the active
> - You should never get any AP items on Leona support. You want Health > CDR > Armor/MR

^ This

The answer to my question was (in the current meta, of course):

1) Provide vision control for your team. All supports should get a sightstone, but not only that, a **sweeping lens**. This is your main job, to deny the enemy vision, and provide it for your team. You just learnt something that you didn't know in three years of playing the game.

2) Peeling for your carries. This doesn't mean doing damage. You are not the carry, you are the support. Items that have actives can be purchased to do all kinda of peeling/shielding/crowd controlling the enemies. Only if they game is going very late and support finally get some gold to play with, can they think about buying damage items, and even then you don't give up your ability to peel. For example  a support may choose to build an AP item like a deathcap, or they can buy a vision ward for the 6th item slot. That vision ward could make or break the game.

If bronze noobs go all AD, its unlucky, but still, remember your **role**. One thing that annoys me when i am ADC is supports constantly engaging in stupid fights. For example a thresh who would land every hook and then go in on their Q and die, then blame the ADC for not following up. There is a time to fight and a time to be patient while the ADC farms. As a support you should be thinking "what does the ADC need right now?". Harassing the enemies is the lowest priority of the support player. A good idea in bronze is to ping your attack on the enemies and then see what the ADC thinks. Or type to them "we should do this, or this...". Bronze have limited map awareness, so pings are very useful, even in the direct lane.

Good Luck!
Why are you buying the eye of the equinox and not face of the mountain. you sacrifice cdr early and an active component of peeling for your adc?

Because its gold efficient and gives me an extra slot to buy more tank stats so that i can peel for my adc. Are you looking at the game that our team was so far ahead and won in 20 minutes or the one where the opposition had 4 AP champions and I needed to be a frontline with the Poppy? Face of the mountain is not always a requirement my friend. I just love how gold efficient the Equinox is. Mata agrees.

i was just looking at the majority of the games and everything I've been told by higher players (not hard silver 5 is basically bronze lol) is that the face of the mountain is just as gold efficient if not better because of the cdr and most games don't go long enough to effectively make use of another item
mate its a duo lane if your adc is passive try playing for harras other than all ins. if your adc is super aggressive then go ham cos they will follow. make sure you ping too.

Aside from knowing the basics, being a good support is knowing how to work in with your adc. Whats the point of going full aggressive if your adc is passive, you are a "duo" , this is a team game, work together.

Here's some tips:
- You should be buying Sightstone in 100% of your support games
- Damage isn't important for tank supports so try swapping out your Sunfire purchases with Randuins for the active
- You should never get any AP items on Leona support. You want Health > CDR > Armor/MR

While i know where your coming from and in an ideal not bronze world you would be 100% correct. I have been finding pure tank less successful in the current ad/pen/bruiser meta. I was building pure tank for quite some time but have found having ~some~ ap bruiser potential helps team fights (epspeicaly if i land a good ult at the start of a group fight). The other proviso is i am in a lot of teams with ADC AD mid AD bruiser Top and or Jungle.. So having some AP output on the team becomes a necessity.
